com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasID, java.io.Serializable

    public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
implements HasID, java.io.Serializable
    A small block object hich stores only id and value and is only used for storing in memory. Stores only 8 bytes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GAME_DIAGLENGTH
      The game space dimension size's aequivalent to VIEW_DEPTH or VIEW_WIDTH.
      static int GAME_DIAGLENGTH2
      Half (1/2) of GAME_DIAGLENGTH.
      static int GAME_EDGELENGTH
      The game spaces dimension in pixel (edge length). 1 game meter ^= 1 GAME_EDGELENGTH The value is calculated by VIEW_HEIGHT*sqrt(2) because of the axis shortening.

      Half (1/2) of GAME_EDGELENGTH.

      The half (1/2) of VIEW_HEIGHT.

      A quarter (1/4) of VIEW_HEIGHT.

      The width (x-axis) of the sprite size.

      The half (1/2) of VIEW_WIDTH.
      static int VIEW_WIDTH4
      A quarter (1/4) of VIEW_WIDTH.
      static float ZAXISSHORTENING
      Some magic number which is the factor by what the Z axis is distorted because of the angle of projection.

    • Field Detail

      • VIEW_DEPTH

        public static final transient int VIEW_DEPTH
        Screen depth of a block/object sprite in pixels. This is the length from the top to the middle border of the block.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VIEW_DEPTH2

        public static final transient int VIEW_DEPTH2
        The half (1/2) of VIEW_DEPTH. The short form of: VIEW_DEPTH/2
        See Also:

      • GAME_DIAGLENGTH

        public static final transient int GAME_DIAGLENGTH
        The game space dimension size's aequivalent to VIEW_DEPTH or VIEW_WIDTH. Because the x axis is not shortened those two are equal.
        See Also:

      • GAME_EDGELENGTH

        public static final transient int GAME_EDGELENGTH
        The game spaces dimension in pixel (edge length). 1 game meter ^= 1 GAME_EDGELENGTH The value is calculated by VIEW_HEIGHT*sqrt(2) because of the axis shortening.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • hasSides

        public boolean hasSides()
        Description copied from interface: HasID
        Is the block a true block with three sides or does it get rendered by a single sprite?
        This field is only used for representation (view) related data.
        Only used for blocks. Entities should return false.
        Specified by:
        hasSides in interface HasID
        Returns:
        true if it has sides, false if is rendered as a single sprite

        public void setAOFlagFalse(int side)
        Set flags for the ambient occlusion algorithm to false
        Parameters:
        side -

      • getAOFlags

        public int getAOFlags()
        byte 0: left side, byte 1: top side, byte 2: right side.
        In each byte bit order:
        7 \ 0 / 1
        -------
        6 | - | 2
        -------
        5 / 4 \ 3
        Returns:
        four bytes in an int

      • setAoFlags

        public void setAoFlags(int aoFlags)
        Set all flags at once
        Parameters:
        aoFlags -
